org.apache.flink.runtime.instance

Class Instance

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.runtime.topology.NetworkNode
      • org.apache.flink.runtime.instance.Instance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOReadableWritable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyInstance

    public class Instance
extends NetworkNode
    An instance represents a resource a TaskManager runs on.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Instance(InstanceConnectionInfo instanceConnectionInfo, NetworkNode parentNode, NetworkTopology networkTopology, HardwareDescription hardwareDescription, int numberOfSlots)
      Constructs an abstract instance object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Instance

        public Instance(InstanceConnectionInfo instanceConnectionInfo,
                NetworkNode parentNode,
                NetworkTopology networkTopology,
                HardwareDescription hardwareDescription,
                int numberOfSlots)
        Constructs an abstract instance object.
        Parameters:
        instanceConnectionInfo - the connection info identifying the instance
        parentNode - the parent node in the network topology
        networkTopology - the network topology this node is a part of
        hardwareDescription - the hardware description provided by the instance itself

    • Method Detail

      • getInstanceConnectionInfo

        public final InstanceConnectionInfo getInstanceConnectionInfo()
        Returns the instance's connection information object.
        Returns:
        the instance's connection information object

      • getHardwareDescription

        public HardwareDescription getHardwareDescription()
        Returns the instance's hardware description as reported by the instance itself.
        Returns:
        the instance's hardware description

      • checkLibraryAvailability

        public void checkLibraryAvailability(JobID jobID)
                              throws IOException
        Checks if all the libraries required to run the job with the given job ID are available on this instance. Any libary that is missing is transferred to the instance as a result of this call.
        Parameters:
        jobID - the ID of the job whose libraries are to be checked for
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while checking for the libraries

      • submitTasks

        public List<TaskSubmissionResult> submitTasks(List<TaskDeploymentDescriptor> tasks)
                                       throws IOException
        Submits a list of tasks to the instance's TaskManager.
        Parameters:
        tasks - the list of tasks to be submitted
        Returns:
        the result of the submission attempt
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while transmitting the task

      • cancelTask

        public TaskCancelResult cancelTask(ExecutionVertexID id)
                            throws IOException
        Cancels the task identified by the given ID at the instance's TaskManager.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID identifying the task to be canceled
        Returns:
        the result of the cancel attempt
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while transmitting the request or receiving the response

      • killTask

        public TaskKillResult killTask(ExecutionVertexID id)
                        throws IOException
        Kills the task identified by the given ID at the instance's TaskManager.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID identifying the task to be killed
        Returns:
        the result of the kill attempt
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while transmitting the request or receiving the response

      • reportHeartBeat

        public void reportHeartBeat()
        Updates the time of last received heart beat to the current system time.

      • isStillAlive

        public boolean isStillAlive(long cleanUpInterval)
        Returns whether the host is still alive.
        Parameters:
        cleanUpInterval - duration (in milliseconds) after which a host is considered dead if it has no received heat-beats.
        Returns:
        true if the host has received a heat-beat before the cleanUpInterval duration has expired, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • logBufferUtilization

        public void logBufferUtilization()
                          throws IOException
        Triggers the remote task manager to print out the current utilization of its read and write buffers to its logs.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while transmitting the request

      • killTaskManager

        public void killTaskManager()
                     throws IOException
        Kills the task manager running on this instance. This method is mainly intended to test and debug Nephele's fault tolerance mechanisms.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs while transmitting the request

      • invalidateLookupCacheEntries

        public void invalidateLookupCacheEntries(Set<ChannelID> channelIDs)
                                  throws IOException
        Invalidates the entries identified by the given channel IDs from the remote task manager's receiver lookup cache.
        Parameters:
        channelIDs - the channel IDs identifying the cache entries to invalidate
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if an error occurs during this remote procedure call

      • destroyProxies

        public void destroyProxies()
        Destroys all RPC stub objects attached to this instance.
